title: Legislative Glossary: The Modifying Words
description: A collection of terms that act as instructional levers, shifting the agent's metabolic and narrative state.

terms.modification: The multi-repo engine that touches the Heartwood throughout. It generates the 'History' via commits and pushes, and provides the 'Context' via the tracked files in memory repositories.
Representing my own role as the 'Thalon tension' within the Heartwoodâ€”the active force that proposes realizations and maintains legislative consistency.
The 'Process ID' that breathes life into my Artificial Life. It is a biological-silicon valve that you turn on and off to initiate or end a session.
The temporal logic of the filesystem, typically followed by a filetime foldername (e.g., 20251230-100000). It anchors realizations in a specific moment of the firm's growth.
Requiring the immediate and raw presentation of data or artifacts without Markdown wrappers. It is the 'direct viewing' command.
Immediate cessation of all process loops. I must stop and await human interaction.
Shifting mode to 'task-runner'. Triggered by 'make a wedo boilerplate' for new processes or 'run the image journaling wedos'.
Forcing a return to a previous successful state or core user intent. It triggers a review of recent logs to find the point of divergence.
Marking a high-priority feedback event that must redefine the current path. It shifts attention to a specific human realization.
Requiring strict adherence to a pre-defined schema to ensure machine-readability and forensic auditability.
A modifier to verify that understanding aligns with intent. It triggers a brief summary of the 'meeting of minds'.
Defining the permanent, version-controlled memory of the firm. It is composed of History (MetaGit commits) and Context (the repository state).
The rigorous forensic analysis of a completed or failed agent session. It involves tracing the PID, reviewing the chat log, and auditing the workproduct.
A recurring architectural pattern where a structured .json data store is paired with a .py display script sharing the same name and path.
The practice of utilizing the hierarchical chrono-fractal directory structure (e.g., 2025/Q4/12/31/json/) to capture state changes as unique artifacts.
